original: Kjerrman, Bengt Adam, bergsingenjör, Göteborg, f. 5/8/89 i Stlilm. av red:sekr. Fritz K. o. förf :an Anna Wahlenberg. G. 16 m. Polly Craeldus. Barn: Ulf f. 16, mg., Sthlm, Malin 18, g. m. civ :ing. Birger Norinder, Hans 21, ekon. istud., Anna 30, stud. — Mo’e::ex. v. norra real i StMm 08, KTH (B) 08-14, Dr-Ing. v. Techn. Hoch-schule i Breslau 21 samt stud. v. bl a. Bureau of Standards i Washington 25-26. Stud :res. i Europa, Amer. o. Asien, statsdeleg. v. världsing :’kongr. i Tokio 29. Stip. v. IVA 21. Assist, i bergsniek. v. KTH 13-14, vik. lär. v. bergs.sk. i Filipstad 14, förest, f. mek. avd. v. KTH materialprovn :anst. 15, chef f. lab. o. glödgn :verk v. Avesta Jejnv. A-B 16-18, v. Klosters A-B i Långshyttan 18-26, chef i. centr :lab. o. härdnrverk v. SKF i Gbg sed. 27. Led. av styr. f. gjuterisekt. av Sv:es mek. verkst. förb. -sed. 43, av dess forskn:utsk. sed. 44 samt av metallo-graf. inst. råd sed. s. å. Skr.: Ueber das Glühen von Stahl zur Erhöhung der Bearbeitkeit durch schneidende Werkzeuge (21), Materialprovn. (24), Perlitintervallet (25), upps. i in- o. uti. facktidskr.
translated:
Kjerrman, Bengt Adam, mining engineer, Gothenburg, born on August 5th, 1889 in Stlilm, son of editor:secretary Fritz K. and author Anna Wahlenberg. Married on June 16th, with Polly Craeldus. Children: Ulf, born in 1916, married, living in Stockholm; Malin, born in 1918, married to civil engineer Birger Norinder; Hans, born in 1921, studying economics; Anna, born in 1930, studying. 

Education: Graduated from Norra Real in StMm (Stockholm) in 1908, attended the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1908 to 1914, obtained a Doctor of Engineering degree from the Technical University of Breslau in 1921, and studied at various institutions including the Bureau of Standards in Washington from 1925 to 1926. Also undertook study trips in Europe, America, and Asia, and served as a delegate at the World Engineering Congress in Tokyo in 1929. Received a scholarship from the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA) in 1921.

Work experience: Assistant in mining engineering at KTH from 1913 to 1914, substitute teacher at the mining school in Filipstad in 1914, head of the mechanical department at KTH's materials testing institute in 1915, chief of the laboratory and annealing plant at Avesta Ironworks AB from 1916 to 1918, at Klosters AB in Långshyttan from 1918 to 1926, and head of the central laboratory and hardening plant at SKF in Gothenburg from 1927. Member of the board of the foundry sector of the Swedish Engineering Industries Association since 1943, of its research committee since 1944, and of the council of the Metallographic Institute since the same year.

Publications: "Ueber das Glühen von Stahl zur Erhöhung der Bearbeitkeit durch schneidende Werkzeuge" (1921), "Materialprovn" (1924), "Perlitintervallet" (1925), and various articles in national and international technical journals.

work.roleName: Chief of Laboratory and Hardening Plant
Head of Central Laboratory and Hardening Plant

publications.name: Ueber das Glühen von Stahl zur Erhöhung der Bearbeitkeit durch schneidende Werkzeuge
